channel.title: Illustration on Konigi
channel.description: Recent content in Illustration on Konigi

item.description: Rule 1. Find a place you trust and then try trusting it for a while. &emdash;Sister Corita Kent.
Brooklyn, I still think about you sometimes.

Some says you start out feeling great and the smallest thing can trigger you and make the rest of the day a challenge. This muddy representation of what was a beautiful Sausalito sunrise reflects that.
And I seem to find the happiness I seek…

item.title: mapsicon
item.description: Mapsicon is a free collection of maps for nearly every country in the world, available as PNG in 11 different sizes, ranging from 16x16 pixels to 1024x1024 pixels, as well as in .svg format. Useful for placeholders or for illustrative purposes, rather than for precise rendering of geography. https://github.com/djaiss/mapsicon

item.title: SketchMine: Sketch app templates
item.description: Sketchmine provides .sketch files for use in Bohemian Coding’s Sketch app for Mac. The files are free to download and are contributed by the Sketch community. http://sketchmine.co/

item.title: Alan van Roemburg
item.description: A Melbourne based designer, specialising in graphic design, web design and icons. http://alanvanroemburg.com

item.title: Andy Ward
item.description: Portfolio showcasing the illustrations of Andy Ward http://www.andyward.co.uk/

item.title: Flower Press Creative Studio
item.description: The redesign of the Flower Press Creative Studio website is fresh, approachable and showcases client work in a case study format. The site uses standards compliant CSS throughout. Since 2001 our full-service creative studio has provided comprehensive services in the areas of brand identity, user experience, development and print. http://www.theflowerpress.net

item.title: robertogadotti.it
item.description: a new vers ready for 2010 I gave more importance to the emotional impact that usability. http://www.robertogadotti.it

item.title: Zara Picken Illustration
item.description: Lovely minimalist portfolio of UK illustrator Zara Picken. http://www.zaraillustrates.com/index.html

item.title: Flutter + Wow
item.description: I like the prominent header, and the fun use of illustration on this site, especially in the header and footer. The grass overlapping tabs, and the whimsical footer tunnels are great. http://flutterandwow.com

item.title: Happy Webbies
item.description: Desktops and shirts for web designers. The messages hold the world of lesser designers and developers in contempt, but the illustration is great. http://www.happywebbies.com/

item.title: Joe
item.description: The whimsical sketched interface of Joe Davis’ design portfolio. http://www.joedavis.co.uk/

item.title: FatCow
item.description: Love the nutritional information panel on the right of this promo landing page. It’s ashame they don’t use a fun graphic like this on the regular home page. http://www.fatcow.com/fatcow/special-promo.bml#ic

item.title: Cobblestone Community Network
item.description: Excellent use of subtle shadows and gradients in the header navigation. The faint radial gradient for the lighting effect on the centered logo is perfect, perhaps making reference to the light from a church apse shining down on an alter, which of course has symbolic meaning. It’s a very subtle thing, and I’m not sure it’s intended, but it has a powerful effect and adds a subtext to the design.

item.title: Crayons Life
item.description: The portfolio of illustrator and web designer Jessette Dayate, which pays homage to the crayon. http://www.crayonslife.com/

item.title: Carsonified
item.description: Carsonified redesigns with bold monochromatic pages with a retro look that feels insired by poster art. Sweet. http://carsonified.com/

item.title: keepa
item.description: The gang is based in Lviv, Ukraine and consists of two designers and illustrators. Collaborate with web and software developers in the area of interface and design solutions. Works with advertisement agencies and magazines, draw illustrations. http://www.hellokeepa.com

item.title: Volkswagen Lifestyle Vehicles (UK)
item.description: Love the soft texture of the water color background and the animated illustration that appears when you hover over the vehicles. http://www.volkswagen-vans.co.uk/escape/

item.title: Open Atrium
item.description: Simple product announcement page for Open Atrium, an open source intranet package powered by Drupal. The sidewards illustration seems to suggest, perhaps, a flourishing ecosystem turned on its head. http://openatrium.com/

item.title: yay!everyday
item.description: yay!everyday is community inspiration gallery focussed on sharing images that showcase artists, designers, and their work. Love the random sort option, and the staggered placement of the gallery of images which feels like an installation of paintings on a gallery wall. http://yayeveryday.com/

item.title: inezborges
item.description: inezborges, is a graphic and designer web working on Oporto. Specializing in Web and Print Design, she creates clean, engaging, and functional websites. Nowadays, she spends most of her free time in researching web design technologies. She´s working in the internet industry, focusing on web design as well as user interface design, web 2.0. http://www.inezborges.com

item.title: Pixmac - royalty-free pictures & illustrations, photos & stock images
item.description: Over 3 millions of professional royalty-free photos of about anything are available online through the PIXMAC microstock photobank (www.pixmac.com). Press, graphic designers or bloggers can order photographs they need. The customers can browse the photos by keywords, or they can use the unique database of fresh, daily updated royalty-free celebrity photos. Although Pixmac sell the photos cheaply, it pays the authors well thanks to the size of the global Internet market.

item.title: WeatherFlash
item.description: Nicest weather site on the internet with current condition and weather forecasts for all world cities. http://weatherflash.com/canada/bc/vancouver

item.title: rudpunk.com
item.description: Nice simple portfolio of Eugene Rudyy, Ukrainian designer and illustrator. http://www.rudpunk.com/

item.title: EstÃºdio Alice
item.description: Brazilian illustration and design studio Estúdio Alice is a single page portfolio with absolutely gorgeous illustration. Via @innstudios http://www.estudioalice.com.br/

item.title: Index Ventures
item.description: I love the isometric illustration for this little cityscape on this venture capital firm’s splash page, which feels light and loaded quickly. I wish they found a way to fit a little bit more about what the company does into the design, e.g. in that scrolling ticker. Via Andrew http://www.indexventures.com/

item.title: Unstoppable Robot Ninja
item.description: This is a bad-ass looking weblog with a very cool header. Big type and ample white space sets up a very clear visual hierarchy and makes it easy to read, and a strong center alignment of header/footer elements directs the eye. I love the big illustrated robot head in the header (kind of expecting it to wink at me) and the character photos in the footer. I also like the way the global navigation shifts so that the center link is whatever section you’re viewing, which makes that centered look and directs your eyes downwards.

item.title: The Darling Tree
item.description: Joanna Klima is a freelance designer and craftsperson. I love the decorative fluorishes behind the body, the textured backgrounds, and the overall tone of the copy. There’s a very handmade feel to the site, which goes along with the idea of providing more personal service, and the aesthetic that Klima is known for. http://www.thedarlingtree.com/index

item.title: Realmac Software
item.description: Realmac Software is the maker of LittleSnapper and RapidWeaver apps for the Macintosh. Their site sports the kind of clean rounded corners and beveled edges we come to associate with Apple, but brings in a more colorful and rich palette with excellent illustrations and product icons throughout. Glassy reflective marquees melt into the 2 column product info below, and big icons and buttons make clear targets for calls to action.

item.title: Mediocore - David Arazim Graphic Designer
item.description: Beautiful single page portfolio of illustrator David Arazim’s work. http://mediocore.cz/

item.title: Berit SÃ¸mme
item.description: The portfolio of Norwegian illustrator Berit Sømme sports an ultra clean simple grid to showcase some fantastic stylized illustration. The header uses large, clear navigation, puts the designer’s phone number front an center. A portfolio doesn’t get any more straight forward than this. Fabulous. http://www.somme.no/

item.title: Printable Paper Rulers
item.description: This is a pretty cool idea. A collection of rulers you can print. http://www.vendian.org/mncharity/dir3/paper_rulers/

item.title: Back of the Napkin
item.description: I can’t think of a more appropriate site for a cute hand drawn interface than for The Back of the Napkin book site. This is a great book for anyone who wants to expand their tools for business thinking. Dan Roam provides a friendly approach and simple formula to using drawing to collect, analyze, and communicate problems and ideas, and you don’t need to be good at drawing to do it.

item.title: Sesame Street
item.description: The Sesame Workshop and PBS produce excellent Flash sites for kids. Among my favorites are the Sesame Street and Arthur sites. The recent redesign of the Sesame Street site adds new navigation options, a more YouTube-like video section, and most notably, user profiles. The best of the new features is the ability to add favorites to “Your Street,” a user profile page that uses your favorites to display a start page.

item.title: The Heads of State
item.description: The Heads of State are a 2 person design studio in Brooklyn and Seattle. Their recently redesigned site showcases the strong portfolio of print work on projects including book covers, magazine illustrations, and corporate identity. I love the simple, powerful covers on the Rosenfeld Media books, and after diving into their site, I think I’d love even more to hire them in the future. https://www.theheadsofstate.com/

item.title: Beautiful Icon Sets on deviantART
item.description: Noupe curates a list of 40 free icon sets showcased in the deviantART icons gallery. http://www.noupe.com/freebie/40-extremely-beautifull-icon-sets-hand-picked-from-deviantart.html

item.title: D I S T U R B A N I T Y
item.description: Graphic designer and illustrator Matthias Gephart works on music industry, cultural assignments, magazine editorial, sports, and fashion projects. His portfolio is a clean and simple, which serves to really give the lovely illustration center stage. http://www.disturbanity.com/

item.title: rob dobi
item.description: Rockin portfolio from illustrator rob dobi. Love the subtle 3D effect on the heading, and the big galleries of thumbnails. The old school frames actually work very well for this site. http://www.dobi.nu/

item.title: krolikov
item.description: Krolikov is the illustration and animation studio of Russian designer Sedova Elena. Great illustration, and the subtle 3d effect of the boxes adds dimension and interest to the frame surrounding the content. The little touches of animation are brilliant, e.g. the plug in effect on the home link electrical cord and the little motion when mousing over the global nav. I was sort of expecting the little character on top of the books to wink at me or something.

item.title: Little Chimp Society Illustration Blog
item.description: Little Chimp Society is a weblog that showcases great illustration. http://thelittlechimpsociety.com/

item.title: Vintage Logos
item.description: “A collection of vintage logos from a mid-70’s edition of the book World of Logotypes” Check the logo set on flickr. http://www.flickr.com/photos/mr_carl/sets/72157604144345854/

item.title: The Superest: Who is the superest hero of them all?
item.description: I absolutely love the idea The Superest, a game/blog that features drawings of superheroes. The Superest is a continually running game of My Team, Your Team. The rules are simple: Player 1 draws a character with a power. Player 2 then draws a character whose power cancels the power of that previous character. Repeat. To experience the fun in order, start at the first hero. http://www.thesuperest.com/

item.title: T A M A R A M U L L E R
Pixelmind
item.description: Pixelmind is the portfolio Li Chin, a Malysian web designer residing in Sweden. She emphasizes that she likes to create clean, simple designs with easy navigation. That ability is clearly evidenced in this site, which is one of the most refreshing portfolio designs I’ve come across in some time. The sketches of Li in various poses, including holding a placard of the local navigation, and in the treatment of the site title, global navigation and buttons really give the site personality, without being too cutesy.
